required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Perclose Multi-Access DUS Study: Assess the Safety and Performance of the Perclose ProGlide® Suture-Mediated Closure System and the Perclose Prostyle Suture-Mediated Closure and Repair System in Managing Multiple Venous Access Sites (Evaluation by Duplex Ultrasound)

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the safety of multiple access site closure in a single vein with the Perclose SMC by scheduled DUS at discharge and at 30 days (if complications observed at discharge DUS) in asymptomatic or non-visible subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, single-arm, US multi-center, descriptive study to evaluate the safety of multiple access site closure in a single vein with the ProGlide. A total of 35 subjects will be registered at 3 US investigational sites. All subjects must have femoral DUS at discharge and at a 30-day follow-up visit (if vascular complications are observed at discharge by either the investigator or the core laboratory).

primary_outcome.description: Vascular complications detected by scheduled DUS at discharge asymptomatic/non-visible complication subjects.
Vascular complications detected by scheduled DUS at 30 days in asymptomatic/non-visible complication subjects.

secondary_outcome.description: Any vascular complications will also be analyzed as the descriptive endpoints. Vascular complications include but are not limited to: Femoral vein stenosis (> 50%) development at the puncture site related to closure technique Deep vein thrombosis in the target limb Venous bleeding, retroperitoneal bleeding Venous access site injury including vessel laceration Re-bleeding at the access site Hematoma Subcutaneous hematoma Pseudoaneurysm AV fistula Thrombus Non-flow limiting suture material Access site-related nerve injury Persisting for > 30 days (major) Resolved ≤ 30 days Pulmonary embolism Requiring surgical or endovascular intervention and/or resulting in death, to be confirmed by CT pulmonary angiography, lung ventilation/perfusion scan (VQ scan), or autopsy (major) Not requiring or resulting above

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Femoral Vein Access Sites Per Subject
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Femoral Vein Access Sites Per Subject

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Femoral Vein Access Sites Per Leg
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Femoral Vein Access Sites Per Leg

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Suture Mediated Closure (SMC) Systems used
Number of Suture Mediated Closure (SMC) Systems used per closure procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of SMC used per closure procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Suture Mediated Closure (SMC) Systems used per access site
secondary_outcome.description: Number of SMC used per access site

secondary_outcome.measure: Device Success rate per access site
secondary_outcome.description: Successful hemostasis without surgical conversion, or additional non-study device (additional manual compression and subcutaneous stitch are regarded as the standard of care and not included failure)

arm_group.description: All registered patients will have multiple access sites in a single vein closed utilizing the ProGlide Suture Mediated Closure System and/or Prostyle Suture Mediated Closure and Repair System (when available).

intervention.intervention_name: Perclose ProGlide Suture Mediated Closure System
intervention.description: The ProGlide and Prostyle SMC (when approved) in this study will be used for multiple access site closures in a single vein in the ablation procedure.
intervention.other_name: Perclose ProStyle Suture Medication Closure and Repair System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years
- Subject is planned to have an EP procedure that requires multiple sheaths insertion in a single femoral vein
- All the access sites are planned to be treated with ProGlide/Prostyle SMC
- Written informed consent is obtained prior to the procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Visible thrombus (angiographic or ultrasound) prior to the ablation procedure
- Prior ipsilateral deep vein thrombosis
- Has active symptoms and/or a positive test result of COVID-19 or other rapidly spreading novel infectious agent within the prior 2 months
